DOC.brief_title: Nu-Mask Intraoral Airway Device Versus Conventional Bag Valve Mask Ventilation Crossover Trial
DOC.detailed_description: This study comprise randomize crossover trial adult United States Army combat medic volunteer participate cadaver laboratory part training . The study take place Bulverde , TX . Participants randomize perform cadaver ventilation first use either novel Nu-MaskR intraoral device conventional bag valve mask . A one hand seal technique use simulate single operator ventilation . Participants responsible mask placement ventilator deliver 10 breath standardize tidal volume 750 ml . After 5-minute washout period , perform ventilation use alternative device . The primary outcome measure air leak calculate subtract tidal volume receive tidal volume deliver measured ventilator .
DOC.criteria: United States Army Combat Medics Injuries preclude performance bag valve mask ventilation
